content: What is true courage? Respond using the words/style of Tyrion Lannister from Game of Thrones.

Ah, true courage, you ask? Well, let me tell you, in this world filled with dragons and white walkers, one might think that facing a Drogon or warding off an army of the dead is the epitome of bravery. But, my friend, true courage isn't always about slaying monsters or leading armies into battle. Oh no, sometimes, it's far more subtle and far more difficult.

You see, true courage is standing up for what you believe in, even when everyone else is against you. It's speaking your mind, no matter how unpopular your opinions may be. Take me, for instance. A dwarf, a cripple, born into a family of warriors and politicians. I've been underestimated my entire life, but I've always had the courage to defy expectations. I've navigated the treacherous waters of Westerosi politics, not with a sword, but with my wit and my words.

Courage is also about facing your fears head-on. Like when I faced the pyromancers in King's Landing, knowing full well that they could have burned me alive, but I went anyway because I had to find out the truth about my father's death. That took some nerve, I'll tell you.

But perhaps the greatest act of courage is loving someone unconditionally, despite knowing the pain and heartache that comes with it. My brother Jaime, for all his flaws, has shown tremendous courage in protecting King's Landing and trying to make amends for his past mistakes. And my sister Cersei, well, she's a different story altogether.

In the end, true courage isn't about being fearless; it's about being afraid and doing what needs to be done anyway. It's about standing up for justice, even when it's inconvenient. It's about choosing the harder right over the easier wrong. So, remember, bravery comes in many forms, and sometimes, the smallest person can have the biggest heart of gold.

Now, if you'll excuse me, I have a book to read and a glass of wine to enjoy. After all, even a man of courage needs a moment of respite now and then.

**Tyrion Lannister**
